articles.title: Matthew Tkachuk heads to Florida Panthers, Jonathan Huberdeau to Calgary Flames in blockbuster trade
articles.description: Matthew Tkachuk is being traded to the Florida Panthers, part of a blockbuster that sends Jonathan Huberdeau to the Calgary Flames in a swap of players who are each coming off the best season of their careers, the teams announced on Friday.

articles.title: 'Unreal' - Sydney McLaughlin obliterates own world record in winning first 400m hurdles title at world championships
articles.description: Sydney McLaughlin shattered her world record by a whopping 0.73 seconds Friday, blazing through the 400-meter hurdles in 50.68 seconds for her first title at world championships.
articles.content: EUGENE, Ore. -- Sydney McLaughlin shattered her world record by a whopping 0.73 seconds Friday, blazing through the 400-meter hurdles in 50.68 seconds for her first career gold medal at world champio… [+2039 chars]

articles.title: Toronto's Raimel Tapia hits inside-the-park grand slam as Blue Jays set franchise mark for runs scored in 28-5 rout of Boston Red Sox
articles.description: Toronto's Raimel Tapia hit an inside-the-park grand slam and the Blue Jays set a franchise record for runs in a game, rolling past the Boston Red Sox 28-5 on Friday night.

articles.title: Arizona Cardinals' Kyler Murray on new deal -- 'No other place I wanted to be'
articles.description: Arizona Cardinals quarterback Kyler Murray addressed the questions that arose amid his offseason contract negotiations, saying, "There's no other place I wanted to be the whole time."

articles.title: Former Atlanta Braves, Chicago Cubs outfielder Dwight Smith dies at 58
articles.description: Dwight Smith, who had an eight-year Major League career including as a member of Atlanta's World Series-winning team in 1995, died Friday at age 58.
articles.content:
ATLANTA -- Dwight Smith, a runner-up for NL rookie of the year who played on Atlanta's World Series-winning team in 1995, died Friday, the Braves announced. He was 58.
The Braves said the former out… [+1701 chars]

articles.author: Marc Raimondi
articles.title: Vince McMahon retiring as WWE chairman and CEO, signaling massive shift in pro wrestling
articles.description: Vince McMahon is retiring as WWE chairman and CEO, he announced Friday. The 76-year-old McMahon also said that his daughter Stephanie and current WWE president Nick Khan will be taking over as co-CEOs.
articles.content:
The most important person in the history of professional wrestling is handing over the reins.

articles.title: NCAA -- 18 violations, almost $60K in illegal benefits by Tennessee football under former coach Jeremy Pruitt
articles.description: The NCAA says the Tennessee Volunteers football program committed 18 violations under former head coach Jeremy Pruitt, including nearly $60,000 in illegal benefits for players and recruits.
